name: Intercontinental Exchange
goal: Intercontinental Exchange is a Fortune 500 and Fortune Future 50 company formed in the year 2000 to modernize markets. ICE serves customers by operating the exchanges, clearing houses and information services they rely upon to invest, trade and manage risk across global financial and commodity markets. A leader in market data, ICE Data Services serves the information and connectivity needs across virtually all asset classes. As the parent company of the New York Stock Exchange, the company raises more capital than any other exchange in the world, driving economic growth and transforming markets.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Single market, Taxation
euInitiatives: ICE follows EU policy developments across a number of policy areas, including financial services, energy policy and climate change.
